intro: Urera sphaerophylla, commonly known as the spherical-leaf urera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a leathery texture. Urera sphaerophylla is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
